fields.description:
h3.Summary
Confluence editor is not able to align multiple table cell content. Apparently, once you select more than one cell in order to implement the alignment, the Editor interprets it as if you just selected the first one of them (In responsive width), and the last of them (in fixed-width).

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a brand new page
# Insert a big table (i.e. 4x20)
# Put some random text within
# Select an entire column and click on the *Align right* button

h3.Expected Behavior
All the column's content will be aligned to the right of its respective cell

h3. Notes
It's also affecting New Confluence Editor (Fabric Editor)

h3.Actual Behavior
When the table is set to have a *Responsive Width*, only the first cell is aligned while the rest stand still. If the table is set to have a *Fixed Width*, only the last cell is aligned.
fields.summary: Align multiple cells at once does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you paste an image from the clipboard into the Confluence editor, the image and upload progress appear. However, after publishing the page, the image does not appear. The image can be seen in Attachments list of the page.

h3. Environment
Windows 10 
Ubuntu 16.04 
Chrome Version 63.0.3239.132
Firefox 57.0.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a Confluence page
# Copy an image from the clipboard
# Paste into the Confluence editor
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
* The image should appear after publishing the page.

h3. Actual Results
* The image does not appear after publishing the page.
fields.summary: When pasting an image into the editor, the image does not appear after publish

fields.description:
Having a keyboard shortcut for creating an inline comment is so natural to me, that I keep hitting c after selecting the text I want to comment on – even though I have seen many times now that it doesn't work. Could this be changed?

So could the keyboard shortcut c create an inline comment if text is selected? I know that c is currently "Create page", but maybe you could change this to n – or just use a different key for "Create comment"...

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When publishing a page with a table (while editing page), Confluence view jumps to the top/bottom (according to the browser) on the page scrolling the screen automatically. This only occurs where the bug CONFCLOUD-57681 happens.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * It happens on Chrome and EDGE/IE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create large Table with dummy content. Must be big enough to were there is a scrollbar present
 # Add an additional section below the table - insert text (doesn't need to be a table). Two sections are enough
 # Publish page - must be published once to reproduce issue
 # Edit page again
 # Scroll the screen down a little
 # Publish the page, the screen view will automatically jump to the bottom/top according to the browser.

h3. Expected Results
 * Be able to publish the page without activating the scroll

h3. Actual Results
 * After publishing the page, the screen view will activate the scroll to the top/bottom

h3. Notes
 * Only occurs when sections are created and added
 * Not data specific and is reproducible
 * Only happens where CONFCLOUD-57681 happens.

h3. Workaround
 * Do not add any additional sections to Page. Remove existing section to only leave one > Issue does not manifest when using only 1 section, although this does not fix scrolling to the top.
fields.summary: Page automatically scrolls up/down after published

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of February 16, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi All,

This ticket was about fixing a reliability issue, which we have done. However, the underlying functionality of renaming/cloning spaces during import wasn't restored, due to a number of technical challenges. The project linking functionality was never actually *intended* to serve as a workaround for renaming/cloning spaces - this was just incidental.

That said, we understand that a lot our users want a way to rename/clone spaces, and if this functionality is to be added back to the product, we would prefer to do so in a more straightforward and usable way.

*We decide which features to prioritize based on customer need, so I would strongly urge you to vote on one (or more) of the following:*
 * [CONFCLOUD-2085 - Rename Space Key|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2085]
 * [CONFCLOUD-2814 - Copy page hierarchy (including attachments)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2814] - NOTE: This was implemented in server, but not in cloud.
 * [CONFCLOUD-3191 - Easily create a copy of an entire space|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3191]
 * [CONFCLOUD-4538 - Creating a Space Template|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4538]

*In the meantime, there are several other workarounds:*
 * Copy pages from one space to another, as advised on the [import space documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/import-a-confluence-space-724765531.html]. This is straight-forward, but can be time consuming for spaces with lots of pages.
 * [Export/import and editing the xml manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html#HowtocopyorrenameaspaceinConfluence-solution3]. This a somewhat technical process, and the current knowledge base article was written for server, though the principle remains the same.
 * [Using the 3rd party Copy Space plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ac-copy-space/cloud/overview]. This solution is provided by a 3rd party, but is Atlassian verified.
{panel}
fields.summary: Linking Jira project during a space import is failing

fields.description:
Some users are distracted by animated gifs that are used within pages, some users want to see the animation then have it stop and others don't want it to animate at all.

A per-user setting would allow the specific user experience to be configured by each user as they require.

Another super simple option would be to allow folding of animated gifs so that they're just not visible any more.

 

The limiting of how many times an animated gif should loop could be done in java script.

A loop value of 0 could be used to disable animating at all perhaps with a clickable icon over/next to the image to trigger the animation on/off or loop once.
fields.summary: Allow per-user setting for max loop count for animated gifs

fields.description:
h3. Problem
- We can't add new content to page without updating the entire page using REST API. Since we only have the call to update content, we cannot just add more information to a page.

Confluence Deletes the previous content and replaces with the new one, using this call:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-put

Also, we can see the example here:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest-api-examples/

h3. Suggestion
- Add a call to add content to a page without replacing all content.

h3. Workaround
- Update full page with a PUT call.
fields.summary: REST API Call for ADD content to a Page

fields.description:

 # Publish a new page
 # Click on the invite to edit icon
 # Copy the share link (this will be a resumedraft.action link)
 # Open the link in a new tab

Also possible to reproduce with:
 # Publish a new page
 # Click on the invite to edit icon
 # Add user to share the page with
 # Follow the email share link sent to the user
 # An error occurs when opening the editor

Seems there is a problem what the link resumedraft.action redirects to. It is of the form "/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/*create*", but it should be "/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/*edit*".

fields.description:
*Summary*

Upon initial Team Calendars  for Cloud setup, and navigate to the Calendars page for the first time ([http://BASE-URL/calendar/mycalendar.action|http://base-url/calendar/mycalendar.action]) you are prompted to select a timezone:

 

 

!Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 10.46.46.png|thumbnail!
 However, it appears that the list of timezones here is much smaller than what is available when changing your profile timezone, or selecting one when creating a new calendar.

For example, I am not able to see any Alaska or Hawaii timezones. (i.e. GMT-9, GMT-10)

*Environment*
* Confluence Cloud
* Team Calendars Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 * Install Team Calendars from Find Add-ons.
 * Navigate to Calendars menu ([http://BASE-URL/calendar/mycalendar.action|http://base-url/calendar/mycalendar.action])
 * You'll be prompted to select a timezone. See attachment.

*Expected Results*
 All timezones available to Confluence users should be listed here.

*Actual Results*
 The list is a smaller list than what is available.

*Workaround*

Select a timezone.
 Navigate to your User Profile and change the timezone there (under Settings)
 Additionally, when creating a new calendar, select the desired timezone.
fields.summary: Timezones missing from initial Team Calendar setup Cloud

fields.description:
We're currently developing an Confluence Cloud app which uses various modules like dialogs, inline dialogs etc.. We've just moved our infrastructure to AWS and are now experiencing problems authenticating the user requests (from dialog Iframes) coming from Confluence Cloud due to no JWT parameter being present.

When we were using an dedicated server, this parameter was present and we we're using it to verify the request including it's claims (for example the license parameter).

We're suspecting that it might have to do with the base url being different from the url of the dialog. Since AWS doesn't provide a good solution to move the APIs as a path of an Cloudfront deployment, we had to use a subdomain to provide API access (for example, the atlassian-connect.json, the js and the dialogs are pointing to app.aws.amazon.com, the base url for all the lifecycle events etc is api.app.aws.amazon.com)

 

Besides, we are also looking for a method to authorize requests to our api coming from the user directly. Is there any way to make requests to external urls with the javascript api or some similar mechanism so we could verify the users identity when he makes an direct request to our api ?

  !image-2018-01-11-21-42-39-420.png!
fields.summary: JWT not present on requests / no method authenticating users request to our API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* New Questions not Generating Email Notifications in Confluence Questions

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Cloud and Questions for Confluence application
*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Once a new question is created, this is what happens at Confluence Question's backend:

* Content is Created
* Questions retrieves a list of watchers to know who should receive notifications
* Once it gets the list, it sends the payload to MailHub which then, delivers the notifications

h3. Expected Results
* Notifications are emailed when new content created

h3. Actual Results
* Content is Created
* Questions wasn't able to retrieve the list of user's who should receive the notification
 
h3. Notes(why this is occuring)
The data retrieving is triggered by the Topic's creator - which is often a regular/non-admin user.
This instance has the following setting regarding User email visibility: only visible to site administrators
So, the user created the Topic, then it tried to retrieve the list of Watchers - which was returning a null value on the e-mail field, since the user was not an Administrator.
It then failed to deliver notifications because Confluence/CQ was able to determine who should receive the notifications but it couldn't see the e-mail addresses related to those users.

h3.Workaround
Possibly: Setting the E-mail visibility to Public, change this security setting
to allow other users to see others emails.
fields.summary: No email notifications for New Questions

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Attachment macro pattern does not have effects on download all option

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Edit any page which has several different attachments types
# Add attachments macro 
# Define a filename pattern 
# Notice that only the files with that pattern are displayed
# Click on “*Download all*” option
# Notice that the zip file contains all attachments on that page and will not take into consideration only the files for which you have setup the pattern 

h3. *Expected Results*
“Download all” option should download only the files which were displayed after adding the pattern.

h3. *Actual Results*
“Download all” option will download all the attachments on that page.


h3. *Notes*
Example: In attachments macro, we choose only the .xml files pattern, therefore, we would expect when we click on "Download all" to have only the .xml files in the zip file but in reality the zip file will get everything including the screenshots.

h3. *Workaround*
No known workaround so far.
fields.summary: Attachment macro pattern does not have effects on download all option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you try to attach files to a page using drag and drop by dragging multiple files. Files are uploaded one at a time instead of the previous behavior that uploads it at the same time.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-e4c9fdd183b
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Page
 # Drag and Drop multiple files to a page

h3. Expected Results

Files should be uploaded at the same time
h3. Actual Results

Files are uploaded one at a time
fields.summary: Drag and Drop of multiple files uploads files one at a time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When creating a retrospective, using Software Project Space Template, in IE 11, user's are not able to see a drop-down list of users when typing their usernames.

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Software Project Space Template;
# On Retrospective, click on *Create retrospective*;
# Start typing the username of an existing user of the instance.

h3. Expected Results
* Drop-down list of Confluence users should show up.

h3. Actual Results
* No list or auto-complete is loaded when typing for the username.

h3.Workaround
* Until this moment, this issue has not been reported either in Google Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Auto Complete/Mentions in Retrospective Page of Software Project Space Template doesn't work in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Chrome Browser's Autocomplete does not populate *Link Address* value in the *Link Editor* on Confluence.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a Page
# Type in some text
# Select the text and click *CMD/CTRL + K* or click the *Chain Icon* on the Editor's toolbar
# Go to *Web Link* on the Sidebar of the Popup
# On the address, type in a few letters (or hit *Up Arrow*), and click on a cached URL
# The *Address* bar will become yellowish, and you can now hit *Insert*
# Click on the link you've just created (still in *Edit Mode*), and click *Edit*

h3.Expected Behavior
The *Address* should be the URL you've "autocompleted"

h3.Actual Behavior
The *Address* bar contains only "http://", or an incomplete URL
fields.summary: Chrome's autocomplete not populating Address in Link Editor properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you have your language set to Italian in your user profile, the *Select file to import* button in the space import menu will no longer work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language to Italian in your user profile: https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action
# Go to the *Import space* menu and attempt to select a file to import: https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/importspace/importconfluencespace.action

h3. Expected Results
A window opens up allowing you to select your file.

h3. Actual Results
The button does not respond.

h3.Workaround
Change your language to a different one and perform the space import then change back to Italian.
fields.summary: The import space button is not responding when profile is in Italian

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Drag and drop a large file (150MB+) to the "Drag and drop to upload or browse for files" box does not upload the file. Additionally, from time to time the drag and drop action opens the file (similar behaviour as the one referred to on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52511, but generated by drag and drop).

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open a File list page on Confluence.
* Drag and drop a file to the "Drag and drop to upload or browse for files" box.

h3. Expected Results
* The file is uploaded to the page. 

h3. Actual Results
* The file is not uploaded, no error message is displayed. 
* Even given enough time, when refreshing the page, the file is not there.
* Additionally, from time to time the file is opened instead of being uploaded. 

h3. Workaround
* Drag and drop the file on the "File  /   Modified" section. 

h3. Notes
* This bug was noticed with smaller files too.
fields.summary: Attach file using drag and drop does not upload the file

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Install any Atlassian owned macro from Marketplace: Better Code Block Macro
 # Create a page and insert macro
 # Publish and export to PDF
 # Notice that Code Block is not included in the exported PDF

More details: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-883 

Cheers,

Anne Calantog
fields.summary: Export to PDF with 'Better Code Macro' Atlassian Macro does not get exported
Icon for adding a row to the bottom of a table is wrong

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While editing Confluence pages, if you open the drop-down menu for the font color, the tooltip will cover the colors on the menu and it will not let you select it.

h3. Environment
(!) Confluence 1000.0.0-6e0ec607b6e

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a Confluence page
2. Click the drop-down arrow next to font color button
3. The tool-tip "More colors" covers several color options and they are unclickable

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to select any Colors. The tooltip should not block the user from selecting colors

h3. Actual Results
The tooltip blocks the user from selecting colors.
 
h3.Workaround
We must hover the mouse until the tooltip goes away
fields.summary: Tool tips cover options of drop-down color menus

fields.description: When the content type of an attachment is changed within confluence (see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/manage-files-724765113.html)] the new content type isn't propagated to media services. When the file is attempted to be downloaded via https://<hostname>.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/<id>/<filename> it gets redirected to media services (https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/...) and will not reflect the updated content type.
fields.summary: Updating content type in confluence doesn't propagate to media services

fields.description:
Hello. My company's confluence contains numerous guides which span as many as 30+ pages, and it's extremely frustrating to have to scroll to the top of the page any time I want to use the table of contents.

It would be immensely helpful if I could designate the right column of my split-section page as "static," IE: the T.O.C. or anything I put there would not move in relation to the rest of the page while scrolling.
fields.summary: [Request] Scrolling Table of Contents or Static Page Section

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When adding files through the import option, the file will be uploaded as an attachment but not displayed in the editor. Besides that, Confluence will allow the user to Publish the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the editor;
# Click on *+ >> Files and Images*
# Upload a file
# Click on Insert

h3. Expected Results
* Confluence would show the file inserted into the editor.

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence doesn't show the file inserted and the button _Publish_ no longer works.

h3.Workaround
* Uploading and inserting a file by drag & dropping works normally.
fields.summary: Insert attachments by uploading files hangs editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Notification Box (notifications-miniview) shows Confluence Workbox instead of Notifications

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Description

Once you click the Notifications bell icon at the Sidebar, it quickly glimpses the *Confluence Workbox* text and switches to *Notifications*

*Note*: It doesn't happen _all_ the time, but it can be stuck at the *Confluence Workbox* text when going from any page to a Space Homepage.
fields.summary: Notification Box (notifications-miniview) shows Confluence Workbox instead of Notifications
Contents of Confluence Questions are not imported into Confluence Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You will not be able to download the exported space (PDF, HTML, XML). It is also affecting downloading generated site backup file.
h3. Environment

1000.0.0-d2ae148c102
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a space (PDF, HTML, XML)
 # Try to download the exported file
 # Access Backup Manager
 # Generate backup
 # Try to download the exported file.

h3. Expected Results
 * You should be able to download the backup file

h3. Actual Results
 * Getting the below error when trying to download exported space (PDF, HTML, XML)
{code:java}
{"error":\{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError","title":"The token TTL exceeds the limit (nbf = 1515397591, exp=1515484051, limit=3600","href":"https://media-api.atlassian.io#UnauthorizedError"}}
{code}

h3. Notes

Fix has been applied.
fields.summary: Unable to download exported space and site backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to upload a PDF file via manual insert method. From the logs, it could be the same root cause as [CONFCLOUD-58739|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58739].

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Edit a page
 # Ctrl + M to open the screen
 # Upload a PDF file
 # *Insert*

h3. Expected Result:
The PDF file is added to the page.

h3. Actual Result:
* File is not added to the page.
* *Close* button becomes disabled.

Browser logs:
{code:java}
image:1 GET https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/936f2332-6680-4645-b5dd-2224ba2bf339/image?height=320px&client=a6623a13-996c-47cb-b84d-1ad01c7a8ed7&token=Nx7JRH5AhiV0&attachmentId=31686729&version=1&mimeType=application%2Fpdf&height=250&thumbnailStatus=200 400 (Bad Request)
{code}

h3. Notes
* Image files are working fine.

h3. Workaround:
* Use "drag-and-drop" method to upload the file.
* Refresh the page (in Edit mode) to enable *Close* button
fields.summary: Unable to upload PDF file

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Unable to fetch all the attachments from a space if it has more than 10K attachments.

You can use the results.links.next property to traverse through next page of attachments. Using this mechanism you'll be able to get 10K attachments, later the request does not yield any result. 

h3. How to Replicate
Below sample query shows that no attachments are fetched, even though still you can still get results.links.next
{code} /rest/api/content/search?limit=50&start=0&cql=space=PTS AND type=attachment ORDER BY id{code}

*Expected Results:*
Able to fetch all attachments

*Actual results:*
No attachments are fetched
fields.summary: Unable to fetch all the attachments from a space if it has more than 10K attachments

fields.description:
I would like to see support for cre tasks and adding mentions to the iOS Confluence app. Is that planned or likely? 

Also have I added this to the correct project - I can’t see a project for the mobile app products?

thanks.
fields.summary: Is support for tasks & mentions coming to iOS apps?

fields.description:
h3.Summary
RSS Feed for Confluence is being generated as a web page, making it unusable in other sources such as Slack, since it is an invalid type of feed by convention. 

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Click on the *(?) Button* on the Sidebar
# Click on *Feed Builder*
# Generate a simple Feed
# Copy the feed link and try validating it in any Feed validator ([W3C Validator|https://validator.w3.org/feed/] or [FEED Validator|http://feedvalidator.sourceforge.net/])

h3.Expected Behavior
The feed should be validated properly

h3.Actual Behavior
The following message is displayed:
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When uploading a .docx file or PDF file onto page, it defaults to being set to display as a thumbnail, however the thumbnail is not generated. To make the page look better, you can switch the attachment to "Show as link". Once this is done, if you attempt to change the link to "show as thumbnail" the "close" button of the editor will grey out and the publish button will no longer function.
Leaving the page does keep changes in the draft.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create any Docx or PDF file and upload it onto a page by drag-and-drop. This will set it to display as a thumbnail.

2) Hit publish to see that the attachment is now displaying a small placeholder thumbnail indicating that the thumbnail was not able to be created or loaded.

3) Edit the page again and set the attachment to display as a link. Publish the page.

4) Edit the page again and try to change the attachment to display as thumbnail.

h3. Expected Results

The thumbnail is generated and displayed and the editor is able to save.

h3. Actual Results
The Editor is not able to save and the close button is greyed out as if no changes were made to the draft.

 
h3. Notes
=== View As Thumbnail ===
 !view as thumbnail.png|thumbnail! 
===

=== After Hitting View As Thumbnail ===
 !After view as thumbnail.png|thumbnail! 
===

=== Example Of Thumbnail ===
 !Example of thumbnail.png|thumbnail! 
===

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this, however you can close the editor page and re-edit the page to post any other changes that you have made to the page.
fields.summary: Attachment Thumbnails not created for Docx and PDF and prevents switching attachment link to show as thumbnail

fields.description:
Currently when external links are entered into Confluence pages, the link points directly to the linked page. This allows the linked site to harvest internal addresses (potentially containing page titles) of a private Confluence instance by logging the browser referrer header.

Confluence should have an option to enable "safe external links". This should include two features: allow the administrator to specify a list of "safe sites" (such as all internal servers) where linking can be direct. Then, if safe linking is enabled, Confluence would link to any pages which aren't on the safe list through an redirect page which would clear the browser referrer.

From: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-i-hide-referrer-info-to-linked-external-sites-779293508.html/:
Confluence users may wish to anonymise external links that exists in their Confluence pages to make sure that the external Websites owners will not be able to see that their sites are being linked in their Confluence page.
fields.summary: Hide referrer info to linked external sites

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the "Preformatted" style on the confluence editor, the format is applied to every new line. Even when the style is changed. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to confluence Site
 # Edit or create a spcae
 # select style "Preformatted"
 # type anything in the text area creating multiple new lines
 # Highlight some of the text and change the style to any style

h3. Expected Result

Only highlighted text should change to new style
h3. Actual results

All text are changed to new style
h3. Workaround

Creating multiple (minimum 4) empty lines from the preformatted text would allow the text now separated. 

Another option is to copy the text to a text editor and copy back to confluence. The text can now be styled separately.

When copying and pasting an entire page, Confluence does it successfully while on the editor, although after publishing the content all the images are not updated. If you already have images with the same name on the confluence page you are pasting the content, they will use the images previously added with the same name, and not the new ones.

(!) Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create two pages, one with text and images, second with different text and different images with the same name of the images from page one.
2. Edit both the pages
3. Select all / Copy from the source page
4. Select all / Paste to the destination page

Images are not updated

Hi all,

This was probably discussed already, and I also found this from a while ago - 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32410

but perhaps there's a new and better way :)

 

Using Confluence cloud 1000.0.0-fa3a2a24710

 

I'm looking for a way (plugin, api, etc) to auto create and populate Jira issue from Confluence.

Scenario+Goal:

Sales person fills in a table with relevant details,

Instead of creating a Jira issue with Macro,

I wish the sales person to, for example, just click on "submit", and the Jira issue will be created with all relevant data populated to relevant fields, and linked in Confluence to Jira issue that was created. One table -> one issue.

||Field name||Field Value||
|Title|Some String|
|Start Date|Some date|
|Description|Some string|
|Custom field - Domain owner|Some Assignee|

Clicks on some button, let's assume "SUBMIT" at the end of the page,

and then automatically a Jira issue is opened and populated with all the relevant fields.

A link to the Jira issue added at, let's say, the bottom of the table (like when inserting a Jira issue via Macro).

 

Hope I was clear :)

Is it possible?

 

Thanks,

Eyal

fields.description:
Confluence single sign on is great. There are multiple authentication methods supported & they work just as expected. We were thinking to reduce number of days a session can stay active or default timeout setting. We observed that session timeout setting is currently not available in confluence. Security is one of the key concern area & looking at cloud based setup, our risk approach to reduce unwanted data leak needs the session timeout values defined based on our requirement. 

If it is possible, we would like to see login timeout/ session timeout customization. It will also help other companies.
fields.summary: Add a globally configurable setting Session timeout

h3. *Environment*
Confluence Cloud

h3. *Steps to Reproduce* 
# In Safari browser
# Open Confluence
# Zoom in
# Notice that the icons on the left bar are missing


h3. *Expected Results*
The last icons should be displayed when Zoom in on a page

h3. *Actual Results*
The last icons on the left bar are not on the page

h3. *Notes*
Issue was reported to be reproducible only using Safari

h3. *Workaround*
Users are recommended to use a different browser when they need to zoom in on a page, like Google Chrome.

fields.description:
Currently Confluence offers the creation of 3 types of lists (bulleted, numbered and task lists).

It is currently not possible to customize the format of lists (such as what numbering convention is used in sub-levels in a numbered list) nor is it possible to add a task within a list. 

Allowing users to customize lists or create lists that combine numbers, bullets and tasks would mean greater flexibility.
fields.summary: Allow customization of lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * In the editor, clicking between two lines that are on the bottom of the page will cause the cursor to jump to the first line of the editor.

h3. Environment
 * Google Chrome, both in normal and incognito window

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page;
 # Add lines to the page enough to scroll down the page;
 # Putting the mouse directly between line "a" and "b" (as in the example), the mouse cursor is always a text carat, which is expected;
 # Putting the mouse directly between line "v" and "w" (as in the example), the mouse cursor will be an arrow/pointer;
 # If you click while the mouse cursor is an arrow, selection will jump to the first line of the document.
 (!) It won't scroll to the top, it will just put the actual text cursor there.

h3. Notes
 * On the inspect window, we can see that the body of the page contains only the visible lines of the page on the browser.

h3. Expected Results
 * Clicking the mouse should leave the cursor where you've clicked.

h3. Actual Results
 * Cursor will move to the top of the page.

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Cursor jumps to top of the screen when clicking on a bottom line

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}



h3. Problem Definition

In the new editor, nesting tables is no longer supported.
h3. Suggested Solution

Is this something that will later be re-introduced, or is it discontinued from Confluence Cloud altogether?

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#4c9aff|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
To be clear on what’s been done, previously in Confluence Cloud, you could place tables inside lists, block quotes, and other tables, we call these “nested tables”. We disabled the ability to create new nested tables. Your existing pages with nested tables are safe and you can still modify these existing nested tables (edit cells, add/remove rows/columns, etc). You just won't be able to create new ones.

As to why we have made this change, there are several reasons:
 * Less than 1% of pages have these nested tables showing there are other ways to get the message across.
 * Nested tables are a huge source of complexity which results in a less reliable editor.
 * Nested tables make pages harder to read, especially on mobile devices.

As part of our broader efforts to create a reliable, predictable, stable, and expressive editor, we have made this change.

Phil Oye, Senior product manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Nesting tables are unsupported

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Links in a Table of Contents macro containing Non-Latin entries will not work (clicking on them will not take you to the appropriate heading) if custom styling is applied to the Table of Contents. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Table of Contents with Non-Latin entries.
# Apply custom styling to the ToC.

h3. Expected Results
Table of Contents performs appropriately.


h3. Actual Results
ToC Links do not work.

 
h3. Notes
When applying custom styling to a ToC the behavior seems to be the exact opposite of the bug described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58551(in which the ToC works, but copying in pasting the link in a new browser window doesn't take you to the appropriate heading; here the ToC doesn't work, but opening the link in a new window takes you to the appropriate heading).

The same behavior happens even if there are no texts inside the Style macro(Style macro is empty).

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Links in ToC do not work if text is Non-Latin and has applied CSS styling

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Reports timeout for REST API /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Add Jira issues filter that should display more than 200 issues
 # Add any of the Chart from Table , Pivot Table and Table filter macros from Table Filter and Charts for Confluence add-on
 # Publish the page
 # Notice that the page is loading and no report is displayed

h3. *Expected Results*

Reports should be properly displayed if the Jira issue filter has more than 200 issues to be displayed.
h3. *Actual Results*

The page is loading and no report is displayed REST API /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view. If we export the page without any macro, the page will be successfully reported.
h3. *Notes*

If we check developer tools, we can see that the page will timeout for request /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view. If we export this page without any macro, all Jira issues will be exported.

*It is possible to increase timeout for REST /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view?*

*/**body.export_view is also affected*
h3. *Workaround*

No known workaround so far.
fields.summary: Reports timeout for REST API /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The backtick (`) markdown to monospace text is not working on macOS using the default US keyboard scheme
(screen record attached)

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* macOS (tested on Sierra 10.12.6)
* any browser
* Using the default (U.S. International - PC) keyboard Input Sources 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try to use the back tick to insert monospaced text
# edit a page
# type *`*
# type any text
# type *`* again


h3. Expected Results
The text inserted between ` ` should be monospaced and the back tick characters shouldn't be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The text inserted between ` ` is not monospaced and the back tick characters are displayed
 
h3. Notes
The layout 'U.S. international - PC' is identical to the 'Brazilian' one

h3.Workaround
Change the Input Sources configuration on Mac to Brazillian
fields.summary: Backtick markdown not working on macOS and US keyboard scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For some instances, we are noticing users with page trees a few levels deep, they are automatically collapsing when clicking on sub-pages.

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Confluence Cloud, New Look
* Browser does not seem to matter but has been replicated in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with several children
# For those children, create a few deeper levels, so that you have at least 4 levels of pages.
# Open the page tree on the sidebar, click a child, and then a child of that child.
# For *some* cases, it will automatically close the entire page tree and you will need to reopen it in order to select its children again.
# *Note* I have only been able to replicate this on the instances that report it. I have not been able to replicate this on my own instance.

h3. Expected Results
Page tree should stay open as long as you are navigating the children in that page tree.

h3. Actual Results
Page tree is automatically closing.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Page Tree automatically collapsing in sidebar

fields.description:
Hi guys,

 

As a Confluence Users, we love the Section Feature.

It allows to structure the ideas and related topics in combination with a good summary.
 * We use it a lot a meeting minutes - with strong summary H2>H3>H4>H5
 * We use it very structured - each Sub topic - even H4/H5 Level in their respective section.

However, while we can deeply use this feature to structure properly an agenda - it could be painful to move Up or Down different sections that consitute a package.

For instance moving a full block H2>H3>H4>H5 - this constituing a package

==> you'll find for instance some transparent example attached.

 

AS A PAGE EDITOR

I would like to be able to 
 * Select different/multiple sections +at the same time (Tickboxes would be ok)+
 * Move Up or Down this multiple selection at the same time for applying a bulk change

 

Bonus
 * This could be done by Drag & Drop to be faster when coming from bottom to top on a long page

 

In case of any precision, feel free to reach out.

Regards
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud / Section > select and move multiple sections at the same time

fields.summary: Unable to access confluence, seeing 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Following the fix for CONFCLOUD-56472, the Team Calendar's creation events are still displayed in the Activity stream even if the add-on was uninstalled or the space does not exist or if the content is restricted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar
# Restrict access to it or delete it or uninstall Team Calendar.

h3. Expected Results
The Creation event is only accessible to users who have access to it in the first place.
Older entries that were displayed because of CONFCLOUD-56472 are cleared and not displayed anymore.

h3. Actual Results
Calendar creation events are always displayed on the Activity Stream even if the add-on was uninstalled.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Restricted and non-existing Calendar's creation events are still showing up in the Activity Stream
